snippet: The study showed that patients made progress when taking the medicine. If replicated, the improvements could offer doctors a standard treatment, experts say.
abstract: Joseph T Giacino and Dr John Whyte study published in The New England Journal of Medicine finds that daily doses of a drug used to treat Parkinson’s disease can significantly improve function in severely brain-injured people thought to be beyond the reach of treatment.
lead_paragraph: The study showed that patients made progress when taking the medicine. If replicated, the improvements could offer doctors a standard treatment, experts say.
